meanings.definition: To make or produce (something) by hand or by machinery.
meanings.sent1: She will manufacture a dress for the party using her sewing machine.
meanings.sent2: The factory will manufacture thousands of cars this month.
meanings.sent3: The robot tried to manufacture a sandwich, but it ended up a mess.
meanings.sent4: His words seemed to be manufactured for the sole purpose of deceiving others.
meanings.sent5: The magician could manufacture a rabbit out of thin air.

meanings.definition: The process of making or producing goods in large quantities.
meanings.sent1: The manufacture of toys in the factory provides jobs for many people.
meanings.sent2: Global trade relies heavily on the manufacture of products in various countries.
meanings.sent3: The children were amazed by the magical world of toy manufacture.
meanings.sent4: The manufacture of ideas can be as complex as the manufacture of physical goods.
meanings.sent5: The city's economy thrives on the manufacture of textiles and clothing.
